title: How to Make Parmesan Chickpeas

methods.name: Frying Parmesan Chickpeas in a Pan

steps.headline: Drain and rinse your chick peas.
steps.description: Canned chickpeas are often packaged with water inside the can. Use a can opener to open the can and then drain any water from the peas. Use paper towel to pat the chickpeas dry. Make sure your peas are well dried before frying them. Drier chickpeas will yield a better end result.

steps.headline: Crisp the chickpeas in a skillet.
steps.description: Put a large skillet over a burner on your stovetop and set it to medium-high. Coat the bottom of the skillet with the olive oil. Insert your chickpeas into the skillet and cook these until they are golden brown and crispy. Stir the chickpeas occasionally while you are cooking them with a wooden spoon or a similar kitchen implement. Although cook times may vary, you can generally expect your chickpeas to cook in about 17 minutes.

steps.headline: Season your fried chickpeas.
steps.description: Turn the heat off and remove the skillet from the burner. Use a kitchen implement, like a wooden spoon, to push the chickpeas out of the skillet and into a mixing bowl. Toss the chickpeas gently with the cheese, garlic powder, lemon rind, oregano, salt, and pepper. If you like your chickpeas to have more of a kick, you might add a little extra garlic powder and pepper.

steps.headline: Serve the chickpeas or store them for later.
steps.description: After seasoning, your chickpeas can be eaten immediately. If you plan on saving these peas for later, spread them out on parchment paper to cool, then put them in an airtight container. Keep these in the refrigerator for about 4 days.

steps.headline: Drain and dry your chickpeas.
steps.description: Open your canned chickpeas and drain them of water. Spread paper towel on the surface of your counter and arrange the chickpeas in a single layer on top of the towel. Allow the peas to air dry for about 30 minutes. Chickpeas that have been thoroughly dried will bake better. If you don’t have time to air dry your peas, pat them dry with paper towel instead.

steps.headline: Preheat your oven.
steps.description: Set your oven to 400°F (204°C). While your oven is heating, you can prepare other parts of this recipe. Depending on your oven, the time this takes may vary. In most cases, you can expect your oven to heat in 10 to 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Coat your chickpeas in oil and season them.
steps.description: Add your chickpeas to a mixing bowl. Use a wooden spoon or similar kitchen tool to toss the peas in 1 tbsp (15 ml) of coconut oil. Sprinkle this with the salt, garlic, and cheese. Toss the ingredients again until everything is evenly distributed. You can use your preferred oil for this recipe. Olive oil, for example, works just as well as coconut oil.

steps.headline: Add the chickpeas to a baking sheet and coat them with oil.
steps.description: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Transfer the peas to the baking sheet so they form a single layer on it. Drizzle the remainder of the oil over the peas. To ensure the peas are thoroughly coated with oil, use a wooden spoon or similar kitchen utensil to toss them again while on the baking sheet.

steps.headline: Bake the chickpeas.
steps.description: Insert the baking sheet into your pre-heated oven. Stir the peas after baking them for about 20 minutes. Bake the peas until they are golden and crispy. This should take roughly an hour. Depending on your oven, it may take more or less time for your peas to bake. Keep a close eye on your chickpeas throughout the second half of their bake-time.

steps.headline: Allow the peas to cool and enjoy.
steps.description: Use a safety implement, like a potholder or oven mitt, to remove the hot pan from the oven. Set it somewhere safe where it can cool. Transfer the peas to serving dishes or an airtight container if you plan on saving them for later. Cooked chickpeas, when refrigerated and stored in an airtight container, should stay good for about 4 days.

steps.headline: Remove the chickpeas from water and dry them.
steps.description: Open the can containing your chickpeas and pour excess water from it. Then use paper towel to pat your chickpeas dry. Alternatively, you can spread them out in a single layer and let them air dry for 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Toss your chickpeas with the ingredients.
steps.description: Transfer your chickpeas to a medium sized mixing bowl. To this, add the basil, Italian parsley, lemon juice, olive oil, pressed garlic, and Parmesan. Use a wooden spoon or similar utensil to toss these until the ingredients are evenly distributed throughout.

steps.headline: Season the salad with salt and pepper and enjoy.
steps.description: Taste your chickpea salad. Add salt and pepper to your salad to adjust its flavor to your preferences. This salad can be made up to 4 hours ahead of time and still retain its freshness. Serve it either hot or cold. You can heat this salad in a microwave or a skillet. Generally, this gives a richer, meltier consistency to the salad. If you’re prepping this recipe for later, cover and refrigerate it until it’s ready to serve.

text: Frying Parmesan Chickpeas in a Pan Drain and rinse your chick peas. Canned chickpeas are often packaged with water inside the can. Use a can opener to open the can and then drain any water from the peas. Use paper towel to pat the chickpeas dry. Make sure your peas are well dried before frying them. Drier chickpeas will yield a better end result. Crisp the chickpeas in a skillet. Put a large skillet over a burner on your stovetop and set it to medium-high. Coat the bottom of the skillet with the olive oil. Insert your chickpeas into the skillet and cook these until they are golden brown and crispy. Stir the chickpeas occasionally while you are cooking them with a wooden spoon or a similar kitchen implement. Although cook times may vary, you can generally expect your chickpeas to cook in about 17 minutes. Season your fried chickpeas. Turn the heat off and remove the skillet from the burner. Use a kitchen implement, like a wooden spoon, to push the chickpeas out of the skillet and into a mixing bowl. Toss the chickpeas gently with the cheese, garlic powder, lemon rind, oregano, salt, and pepper. If you like your chickpeas to have more of a kick, you might add a little extra garlic powder and pepper. Serve the chickpeas or store them for later. After seasoning, your chickpeas can be eaten immediately. If you plan on saving these peas for later, spread them out on parchment paper to cool, then put them in an airtight container. Keep these in the refrigerator for about 4 days. Baking Garlic Parmesan Chickpeas Drain and dry your chickpeas. Open your canned chickpeas and drain them of water. Spread paper towel on the surface of your counter and arrange the chickpeas in a single layer on top of the towel. Allow the peas to air dry for about 30 minutes. Chickpeas that have been thoroughly dried will bake better. If you don’t have time to air dry your peas, pat them dry with paper towel instead. Preheat your oven. Set your oven to 400°F (204°C). While your oven is heating, you can prepare other parts of this recipe. Depending on your oven, the time this takes may vary. In most cases, you can expect your oven to heat in 10 to 15 minutes. Coat your chickpeas in oil and season them. Add your chickpeas to a mixing bowl. Use a wooden spoon or similar kitchen tool to toss the peas in 1 tbsp (15 ml) of coconut oil. Sprinkle this with the salt, garlic, and cheese. Toss the ingredients again until everything is evenly distributed. You can use your preferred oil for this recipe. Olive oil, for example, works just as well as coconut oil. Add the chickpeas to a baking sheet and coat them with oil. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Transfer the peas to the baking sheet so they form a single layer on it. Drizzle the remainder of the oil over the peas. To ensure the peas are thoroughly coated with oil, use a wooden spoon or similar kitchen utensil to toss them again while on the baking sheet. Bake the chickpeas. Insert the baking sheet into your pre-heated oven. Stir the peas after baking them for about 20 minutes. Bake the peas until they are golden and crispy. This should take roughly an hour. Depending on your oven, it may take more or less time for your peas to bake. Keep a close eye on your chickpeas throughout the second half of their bake-time. Allow the peas to cool and enjoy. Use a safety implement, like a potholder or oven mitt, to remove the hot pan from the oven. Set it somewhere safe where it can cool. Transfer the peas to serving dishes or an airtight container if you plan on saving them for later. Cooked chickpeas, when refrigerated and stored in an airtight container, should stay good for about 4 days. Preparing a Parmesan Chickpea Salad Remove the chickpeas from water and dry them. Open the can containing your chickpeas and pour excess water from it. Then use paper towel to pat your chickpeas dry. Alternatively, you can spread them out in a single layer and let them air dry for 30 minutes. Toss your chickpeas with the ingredients. Transfer your chickpeas to a medium sized mixing bowl. To this, add the basil, Italian parsley, lemon juice, olive oil, pressed garlic, and Parmesan. Use a wooden spoon or similar utensil to toss these until the ingredients are evenly distributed throughout. Season the salad with salt and pepper and enjoy. Taste your chickpea salad. Add salt and pepper to your salad to adjust its flavor to your preferences. This salad can be made up to 4 hours ahead of time and still retain its freshness. Serve it either hot or cold. You can heat this salad in a microwave or a skillet. Generally, this gives a richer, meltier consistency to the salad. If you’re prepping this recipe for later, cover and refrigerate it until it’s ready to serve.

Canned chickpeas are often packaged with water inside the can.
Use a can opener to open the can and then drain any water from the peas.
Use paper towel to pat the chickpeas dry.
Make sure your peas are well dried before frying them.
Drier chickpeas will yield a better end result.
Crisp the chickpeas in a skillet.
Put a large skillet over a burner on your stovetop and set it to medium-high.
Coat the bottom of the skillet with the olive oil.
Insert your chickpeas into the skillet and cook these until they are golden brown and crispy.
Stir the chickpeas occasionally while you are cooking them with a wooden spoon or a similar kitchen implement.
Although cook times may vary, you can generally expect your chickpeas to cook in about 17 minutes.
Season your fried chickpeas.
Turn the heat off and remove the skillet from the burner.
Use a kitchen implement, like a wooden spoon, to push the chickpeas out of the skillet and into a mixing bowl.
Toss the chickpeas gently with the cheese, garlic powder, lemon rind, oregano, salt, and pepper.
If you like your chickpeas to have more of a kick, you might add a little extra garlic powder and pepper.
Serve the chickpeas or store them for later.
After seasoning, your chickpeas can be eaten immediately.
If you plan on saving these peas for later, spread them out on parchment paper to cool, then put them in an airtight container.
Keep these in the refrigerator for about 4 days.
Baking Garlic Parmesan Chickpeas Drain and dry your chickpeas.
Open your canned chickpeas and drain them of water.
Spread paper towel on the surface of your counter and arrange the chickpeas in a single layer on top of the towel.
Allow the peas to air dry for about 30 minutes.
Chickpeas that have been thoroughly dried will bake better.
If you don’t have time to air dry your peas, pat them dry with paper towel instead.
Preheat your oven.
Set your oven to 400°F (204°C).
While your oven is heating, you can prepare other parts of this recipe.
Depending on your oven, the time this takes may vary.
In most cases, you can expect your oven to heat in 10 to 15 minutes.
Coat your chickpeas in oil and season them.
Add your chickpeas to a mixing bowl.
Use a wooden spoon or similar kitchen tool to toss the peas in 1 tbsp (15 ml) of coconut oil.
Sprinkle this with the salt, garlic, and cheese.
Toss the ingredients again until everything is evenly distributed.
You can use your preferred oil for this recipe.
Olive oil, for example, works just as well as coconut oil.
Add the chickpeas to a baking sheet and coat them with oil.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Transfer the peas to the baking sheet so they form a single layer on it.
Drizzle the remainder of the oil over the peas.
To ensure the peas are thoroughly coated with oil, use a wooden spoon or similar kitchen utensil to toss them again while on the baking sheet.
Bake the chickpeas.
Insert the baking sheet into your pre-heated oven.
Stir the peas after baking them for about 20 minutes.
Bake the peas until they are golden and crispy.
This should take roughly an hour.
Depending on your oven, it may take more or less time for your peas to bake.
Keep a close eye on your chickpeas throughout the second half of their bake-time.
Allow the peas to cool and enjoy.
Use a safety implement, like a potholder or oven mitt, to remove the hot pan from the oven.
Set it somewhere safe where it can cool.
Transfer the peas to serving dishes or an airtight container if you plan on saving them for later.
Cooked chickpeas, when refrigerated and stored in an airtight container, should stay good for about 4 days.
Preparing a Parmesan Chickpea Salad Remove the chickpeas from water and dry them.
Open the can containing your chickpeas and pour excess water from it.
Then use paper towel to pat your chickpeas dry.
Alternatively, you can spread them out in a single layer and let them air dry for 30 minutes.
Toss your chickpeas with the ingredients.
Transfer your chickpeas to a medium sized mixing bowl.
To this, add the basil, Italian parsley, lemon juice, olive oil, pressed garlic, and Parmesan.
Use a wooden spoon or similar utensil to toss these until the ingredients are evenly distributed throughout.
Season the salad with salt and pepper and enjoy.
Taste your chickpea salad.
Add salt and pepper to your salad to adjust its flavor to your preferences.
This salad can be made up to 4 hours ahead of time and still retain its freshness.
Serve it either hot or cold.
You can heat this salad in a microwave or a skillet.
Generally, this gives a richer, meltier consistency to the salad.
If you’re prepping this recipe for later, cover and refrigerate it until it’s ready to serve.
